page.title: 03LYMM RURAL WALK
page.content: We started from our school and walked south into the countryside. The walk was long and tiring along quiet country lanes. We walked along Lakeside Road past Lymm Dam where there were large houses with long drives, whilst on the other side the lake of the Dam is hidden by woodland. At the end of the road we followed a footpath through the wooded valley of Bradley Brook, and through a muddy area called "The Bongs". This area is easily flooded. The footpath then followed the edge of the woods with first fields of barley and wheat to the west, and then grassed fields with dairy cows. We crossed a stile and on a fence between two fields of wheat we saw three dead moles hung up. We eventually reached the main road to Knutsford.
